metadata.title: CVE-2016-8339 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A buffer overflow in Redis 3.2.x prior to 3.2.4 causes arbitrary codeexecution when a crafted command is sent. An out of bounds writevulnerability exists in the handling of the client-output-buffer-limitoption during the CONFIG SET command for the Redis data structure store. Acrafted CONFIG SET command can lead to an out of bounds write potentiallyresulting in code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8339` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

redis - 5:4.0.9-1
redis-sentinel - 5:4.0.9-1
redis-server - 5:4.0.9-1
redis-tools - 5:4.0.9-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: redis package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5:4.0.9-1').
